page.title: 07SMALLBROOK SHOP NEWTON ST.C.
page.content: Smallbrook farm shop sells eggs, salads,chickens and drinks.Mr.E.Browne who owns the shop has{10,000 battery {hens and 33 geese.He sells 3600 eggs {on average every day.}He supplies 2 shops in Crediton, other shops in Devon and a school in Exeter. { The eggs are graded into 8 sizes _ {number 1 is the biggest.}The machine sends eggs along a conveyor belt.When an egg reaches the right weight it rolls into a column for that weight. {Most of the eggs are grade 3 or 4. A light attached to the machine shows{blood stains and air cracks}in any egg.They are classed as seconds. Most of the old hens lay soft shelled eggs, which are sent to a bakery. Mr. Browne declared that only good quality eggs would sell.He would not supply a national firm because they required{uniformity of shape & colour.
